messages.subject: Teens, sex, and dating
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/12/2003 7:12:52 PM Central Standard Time, ... I m sorry....risk what?  An abortion?  Yes.  It s my legal right. And--thankfully--it
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/12/2003 7:12:52 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

> Yeah, but NONE are 100% preventative. Even if you're using birth control,
> there's always that chance. Are you willing to risk it?

I'm sorry....risk what? An abortion? Yes. It's my legal right.
And--thankfully--it remains my daughters' legal right, too.

(all this is moot, now, as I'm an old married lady. ;-) However, I didn't
support the Emma Goldman Clinic when I was in grad school for the *fun* of
it...That said, I'm sorry if I've inadvertantly brewed up an "abortion
debate." Didn't mean to! Forgive me! <g>)

Becky

"To announce that there must be no criticism of the president, or that we are
to stand by the president right or wrong, is not only unpatriotic and
servile, but is morally treasonable to the American public."
--Theodore Roosevelt


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
